H0.text: when was the first driver 's license required. 1903

H1.text: when was the first driver 's license required. 1915

H2.text: when was the first driver 's license required. 1861

H3.text: when was the first driver 's license required. 1888

A4.text: Section 3 made it compulsory for drivers of motor cars in the United Kingdom to have a driving licence from 'the first day of January, nineteen hundred and four'.

A5.text: Prussia, then a kingdom within the German Empire, introduced compulsory licensing on 29 September 1903.

A6.text: On 1 August 1910, North America's first licensing law for motor vehicles went into effect in the U.S. state of New York, though it initially applied only to professional chauffeurs.
